183881456.review:
This is a game where I feel "at home". 

It is easy to get started, as base game available content is designed to be easy for beginners. 
The game does demand patience, as every other MMO I know of. 

There is housing where you can spend a lot of time decorating, dungeons both on normal and veteran difficulties, tons of daily quest, crafting that is not too deep, and thousands of different sets to use. 

If I have to mention something negative, then I don't enjoy how everything is a bit hidden away. You can never get to anything in a straight line, if that makes sense. Fast travel waypoints are always on the other side of the high cliff, some sets are not available unless you find 11 other people that also needs it, and the speed at which you ride your mount seems extremely slow, even at maximum possible speed. 

The game can be played both casually and hardcore obsessedly. Events are frequent enough to keep you coming back. Just stay away from the loot-boxes, I have never heard anyone getting anything good from them.

The Elder Scrolls Online — это настоящая находка для поклонников серии TES и любителей MMORPG!

Игра радует потрясающей атмосферой Тамриэля, который буквально оживает благодаря детализированному миру, богатой истории и множеству интересных квестов. Каждый регион пропитан уникальной культурой и традициями, а саундтрек только усиливает погружение.

Особенно хочется отметить свободу действий: можно стать кем угодно — от бесстрашного воина до искусного мага или хитроумного вора. Крафтинг, PvP, подземелья, масштабные события — здесь всегда найдется занятие по душе.

А главное, ESO продолжает развиваться: постоянные обновления и дополнения делают игру всё лучше и разнообразнее. Присоединяйтесь к этому удивительному приключению, и вы точно не пожалеете!

10/10 — рекомендую всем, кто ценит глубокий лор, живой мир и захватывающие приключения!

Then i built a nightblade, loved how the sneaky kills can get you a chance for a solo in this game and spent sometime enjoying it. But again, update 44, Devs ruined the nightblade and changed how its skill works. Dumped the char and left the game for good.

Conclusion: when balancing the game YOU DO NOT change the way skill works. YOU CHANGE damage attributes / skill cost until you reach a desired balancing game play. i sincerely got fed up of how those Devs keep changing core skills and how they cast and decided to quit the game.

So if you are reading this review and considering to buy or play, JUST DON'T. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME BUILDING A CHAR THAT DEVS WILL RUIN HOW IT WORKS IN FUTURE PATCHES.

183550949.review:
Long review... TL:DR: Is it even worth it anymore?
Been around since launch. Migrated to Steam only 3 or 4 years ago. So, my hours are not only accumulated here on steam...

This was the last good installment of the TES series. (off topic-ish) I believe TES6 will be garbage, look at starfield lol. 

(back on topic)
I was a parse monkey, progging and an example of listening to the raid lead and parsing and not standing in stupid. I was a decent tanky healer in Cryo. I had free housing from dailies and such but, I kinda decorated the only house I bought, the enchanted snow-globe. Been a faithful with ESO+ for years, because, craft bag. You do not really want to have to play this game without the craft bag, that is the real veteran content of the game (note sarcasm)

I am done.... 
Just done. 
This game is not good anymore. When the zone chat started posting "selling carry runs" I sighed. This means, end game content is done and boring and really nothing left to do except give people fake achievements so they could appear to be veteran. 
All this game is now...
Money dump - scribing so you can actually compete in pvp, housing (good lord the housing) cosmetics (pretty standard) eso+ for the craft bag, crowns for gambling. 
PvP- lagging, disconnecting, mount running simulator... if you can mount due to being bugged and stuck in combat
PvE - well, there is no pve, you just enter a delve and sprint to the boss and then nuke them and then sprint out....Trials is end game and vet is exclusive. So, better start hitting that parse dummy or no one will even listen to you. PvE is a gear grind and boring. 

The servers are a mess, if there is a PvP event, your PvE content will be lagged out bad, or you will disco every 5 to 10 min. Meaning, if you are in a trial or something , you get kicked off the game and have to back out all the way, sometimes reboot, log back in... You're 11 man team will have melted the boss and moved on, you lose your loot. If they do not replace you an add fill. They will never actually fix these servers. PvP lags no matter what. If someone starts bragging about their ping and not being disco'd, they are an elitist and they are lying. 

There is no difficulty curve until you get to veteran, and then it is literally just a matter of gear, upgraded, and not standing in stupid for the dps.. which is everyone anyways, and grouping for a tank. The healer.... lol healing.... is only needed in vet trails, PvP healingis  self heals only, a dedicated healer is almost never necessary except for zergs, and healing for vet dlc content, but, if you don't have ESO+ or dropped a crap ton of money into crowns to buy the dlc's individually, you are not playing that content anyways. 

I am one of the only players who miss the zone difficulty before One Tamerial, after that, it was really really really easy, for the most part, if you have a crafter, you can start soloing world bosses at lvl 20, even lower levels than that if you have a toon leveled to CP160 and above. If you are brand new, you wont be doing that. But, you will not be dying to a pair of wolves like you could in WoW or any other mmo's where you run through a zone crapping your pants because a mob is chasing you down, 

Wish it had not morphed into this. But, it did, and now I am a sad sad panda. I loved this game, I love TES. It is done and over with, sad this was the last great era of The Elder Scrolls.

183545353.review:
Pontos positivos:

Para quem gosta de skyrim e outros jogos da saga elders scrools esse jogo é excelente, você se sente rejogando eles e se divertindo muito.

Tem diversas histórias, uma lore rica e várias e várias quests até mesmo no jogo base

Vc pode upar, distribuir pontos de skills, atributos e outros pontos sem medo de errar. Isso ajuda muito para novatos e para quem está testando determinada classe

Comunidade BR é pequena, mas muito de boas em te aceitar, ensinar e fazer diversos conteúdos

Addons estarem liberados são muito úteis e ajudam a complementar vários pontos que deixaram a desejar no jogo

É possível recriar os sets que já foram coletados, oq facilita muitas coisas, incluindo para brasileiros que querem buscar um set meta no jogo, simplesmente assina por 1 ou 2 meses o eso plus, farma todos os equipamentos, skills e outras coisas e nunca mais precisa assinar

Pontos Negativos:

O jogo não tem localização brasileira, ou seja, não tem tradução oficial, não tem servidor no brasil e a pior parte, nem preços acessíveis

O problema que você descobre nos primeiros 30 minutos de jogo, o inventário ridiculamente pequeno nesse jogo e feito de forma proposital onde nem com mais de 1000 horas de jogo isso se soluciona por completo, com a única solução sendo de pagar o ESO Plus

Esse jogo tem um dos piores modos pvp que eu já vi em um mmo, basicamente se resume em vc deletar ou ser deletado em meio segundo, e ter que ficar partidas de uns 10 minutos, morrendo e renascendo, sendo muito demora cada partida mesmo com o resultado sendo óbvio. Sem falar que para qualquer brasileiro é impossível jogar pelo lag, se você é uma pessoa que quer jogar eso pelo pvp vai se decepcionar muito

Muitas DLCs que são ESSENCIAIS para um jogador, logo quando vc for montar sua build ira se deparar com esse obstáculo, com algumas skills sendo parte de uma dlc, outras com um set de outra dlc e com um sistema de jóias e itens misticos que apenas tem acesso quem paga. Além do mais, estes itens não podem ser comercializados na loja, te obrigando a comprar a dlc ou assinar o eso plus, isso broxa até o jogador casual por tem uma lacuna muito grande até nos para conteúdos PVE


CONCLUSÕES

Excelente para um jogador focado em PVE e péssimo para um focado no PVP.  O jogo é incrível e super envolvente, porém você vai ter que fazer vista grossa para muita coisa, com ele dificultando até coisas que em todo jogo seria simples. como ter uma build funcional e ministrar seu inventário, contudo, até realmente ser de fato necessário fazer uma compra a mais você já vai estar com mais de 300 horas de jogo fácil. Uma localização para o Brasil resolveria 90% dos pontos negativos desse jogo, mas vindo da bethesda é muito difícil que isso aconteça
